result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick D Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge. Court ordered that all court costs, fines and surcharges including DNA be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of Extended Supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

**06-25-2019/Judge Michelle A. Havas
MODIFICATION OF BIFURCATED SENTENCE - Court modified the defendant's sentence to a 5 YEAR term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT. 

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after initial 5 YEARS  confinement. Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: - NO CONTACT with the victim during the period of sentence.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick D Howard

records.addlTxt:
The Petition for Sentence Adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest

-  After consideration of the defendant's petition for sentence adjustment, supporting documents, and the relevant factors, the court finds that sentence adjustment is not appropriate and DENIES the defendant's petition.  The defendant is commended for completing the GED program, and for his positive work evaluation.  However, the defendant's institutional conduct record has been poor, and moreover, the aggravated nature of the offense leads the court to conclude that sentence adjustment is not in the public interest.  Rather, that the full time designated for confinement is necessary to fulfill the sentencing goals of punishment, deterrence, and community protection.

-  signed by the Court (electronically)

Copy to be mailed to defendant
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, calendar successor, for review. cmc

Defendant Patrick D Howard in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Patrick D Howard in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statements made Jeanette S., Jimmy H., and Vernon F.

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 13 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 210 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 8 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS.

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after initial 5 YEARS confinement.The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
No contact with the victim during the period of sentence.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fines and surcharges including DNA be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Patrick D Howard in court with attorney Odalo Joseph Ohiku.  Defendant Patrick D Howard in custody.  Daniel j Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 37.
